$interpreted: Theodore: ... Angelia has already decided to declare war against the Kingdom.
Theodore: List out all the armies we can mobilize right away. We need to draft a strategy for a of Sunshine Infantry!

Jerome: Understood. In addition, after your Majesty departed for Totemtaff, there's been someone persistent about seeing you.
He said he wanted to pledge loyalty to Kingdom of the Sun.
Theodore: Who?
Jerome: He claims to be the disciple of former minister Nikola...
Hyde: King Theodore, it's my honor to have an audience with you. It seems like your plans to defeat the princess aren't going very smoothly.

Theodore: The person I hope to see is your mentor.
Not an unknown brat like you whom I've never heard of.
Hyde: But... Master Nikola passed away last year...
Theodore: Then there's nothing to talk about. Get the guards, take him away!
Hyde: Hyde Oust! For now, please remember this name!
: Three months later
Jerome: General Lucien, we've captured the boss of this stronghold. He was found unconscious on a small path just ahead.
Fredrica: How exhausting~ Not the type I like~
Fredrica: Speak! Where did you hide Angelia?
Bandit Leader: I have no idea! Damnit... we were fooled by that purple-haired bastard!
Fredrica: Purple-haired?
Hyde: He's probably talking about me, I suppose?
Bandit Leader: That's him! He's the one who let the two women escape! Go get him!
Fredrica: Two women? Could it be...

Hyde: Exactly, princess Angelia and her escort Naya.
With my strategies, they've already arrived safely in Totemtaff.
Fredrica: I see. We appreciate your honest confession and for turning yourself in~
Fredrica: Apprehend him!
Hyde: Don't be so hasty~ It's because King Theodore didn't trust me. That's why I had to resort to such lowly tactics to prove my abilities!

Jerome: ... Now I remember. Hyde Oust.
He did visit a few months ago, saying that he wants to pledge loyalty to his Majesty Theodore.
Fredrica: So your way of pledging loyalty is to let a kingdom traitor escape?
Hyde: However, with all the roads back to Totemtaff on lockdown and being surrounded by more than half of Paradise Prairie's forces,
Hyde: I was still able to let Angelia escape. Don't you think that's amazing?

Hyde: The power of Master Nikola's military strategies; 
I believe no one in the world understands it better than King Theodore!
Hyde: This incident is proof that I have inherited all of Master's teachings. Please, give me another opportunity to pledge loyalty to a true king!
Fredrica: You allowed a traitor to escape. You should be glad that you're not in prison. Yet you want us to accept your "help"?
Hyde: Not just Angelia, I am certain that next time, I can have Sunshine Infantry and the Bears all surrender to King Theodore!
Jerome: General, about this man, his Majesty Theodore once ordered that...
Fredrica: Why would his Majesty Theodore trust you?
Hyde: The village where my mentor raised me is not too far down the road. The village school and villagers are all extremely important to me.
Hyde: As long as they are there, I will never rebel against King Theodore.
Fredrica: What do you desire?
Hyde: Money and fame, lots of it.
Hyde: I want to be as renowned and respected as Master Nikola. I don't want to be an unknown school teacher in some random rural village!
Hyde: (Money and fame eh... I wish the things I truly desire are really that simple...)
Fredrica: About the things you mentioned, we are currently investigating them. As with your ability, his Majesty Theodore will be the one to determine!

Fredrica: First, tell me all of your plans. 
If there is even a sliver of fraudulent or inappropriate information, I will kill you!
Hyde: Understood, general Lucien.
